subject: RE: [junit] Could not create task or type of type: junit
msgSnippet: Hey, I d say you re barking up the wrong tree.  Restore your Ant installation to its original state and put junit.jar in ANT_HOME/lib.  You should be all set.
messageBody:
Hey,

I'd say you're barking up the wrong tree. Restore your Ant installation to its original state and put junit.jar in ANT_HOME/lib. You should be all set.

Scott Stirling

-----Original Message-----
From: cpribeiro [mailto:cpribeiro@...]
Sent: Wed 7/2/2003 10:56 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Cc:
Subject: [junit] Could not create task or type of type: junit



Hi my friends,

I'm trying run a test from ant, but when I put ant mybatchtest, I'm
getting the following error message:

Could not create task or type of type: junit

I searched about this error and I found:

The easiest way to do this is to remove optional.jar from
ANT_HOME/lib. If you do so, you will have to <taskdef> all optional
tasks and use nested <classpath> elements in the <taskdef> tasks that
point to the new location of optional.jar. Also, don't forget to add
the new location of optional.jar to the <classpath> of your <style>
or <junit> task.

If you want to avoid to <taskdef> all optional tasks you need, the
only other option is to remove the classes that should not be loaded
via the bootstrap class loader from optional.jar and put them into a
separate archive. Add this separate archive to the <classpath> of
your <style> or <junit> task - and make sure the separate archive is
not in CLASSPATH.

In the case of <junit> you'd have to remove all classes that are in
the org/apache/tools/ant/taskdefs/optional/junit directory, in the
<style> case it is one of the *Liaison classes in
org/apache/tools/ant/taskdefs/optional.

If you use the option to break up optional.jar for <junit>, you still
have to use a <taskdef> with a nested <classpath> to define the junit
task.

I'm using <junit>, then I removed all classes from
org/apache/tools/ant/taskdefs/optional/junit from optional.jar, put
this file in classpath, but I'm getting the same error message.

Someone, could me give a example, how I could do this?

Regards,
Carla
